justification: "In Study 1 we began our process of developing the Speciesism Scale … by formulating and testing a pool of theoretically-validated items to measure speciesism."
"First, to tap racism, we used the Modern Racism Scale (McConahay, 1986)."
"Second, to look at sexism we used the Modern Sexism Scale (Swim, Aikin, Hall, & Hunter, 1995)."

measured_by: Attitudes Toward Lesbians and Gay Men Scale
justification: "Third, to look at homophobia, we used the revised short version of the Attitudes Toward Lesbians And Gay Men Scale (Herek, 1998)."
"SDO was measured using the SDO-6 scale (Pratto et al., 1994), which consists of 8 items…"
"We measured conservatism using a standard measure … participants indicated on two Likert scales … the degree to which they identify as economically and socially conservative."
"Third, we looked at system-justification … The scale consists of 8 items including ‘In general, you find society to be fair’."
"…we looked at right-wing authoritarianism (RWA; Altemeyer, 1988). The scale consists of 15 items…"

measured_by: Empathic Concern subscale of the Interpersonal Reactivity Index
justification: "We used the Empathic Concern scale, which forms part of the Interpersonal Reactivity Index (IRI; Davis, 1983)."
"Next, we looked at actively open-minded thinking … The scale we relied on (Stanovich & West, 1997) consists of…"
"Attitudes Toward Disabled Persons (Yuker, Block, & Young, 1970)… was included in order to control for discrimination against disabled people."

measured_by: Perspective Taking subscale of the Prosocial Personality Battery
justification: "Perspective taking … scales of the pro-social personality battery (Penner et al., 1995) were included…"
